intro: Chuquiraga calchaquina, commonly known as the Calchaquí goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are typically narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss in its native habitat.
